com.scalar.db.sql.springdata

Class ScalarDbJdbcConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.data.jdbc.repository.config.AbstractJdbcConfiguration
      • com.scalar.db.sql.springdata.ScalarDbJdbcConfiguration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware

    @Configuration
 @EnableScalarDbRepositories
public class ScalarDbJdbcConfiguration
extends org.springframework.data.jdbc.repository.config.AbstractJdbcConfiguration
    An extended $AbstractJdbcConfiguration to inject some custom classes to support ScalarDB SQL.

      Constructors

      ScalarDbJdbcConfiguration()

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScalarDbJdbcConfiguration

        public ScalarDbJdbcConfiguration()

    • Method Detail

      • jdbcTemplate

        @Bean
 @Primary
public org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate jdbcTemplate(javax.sql.DataSource dataSource)
        Return a JdbcTemplate instance as a default bean. This is for vanilla Spring Data JDBC usage. This default bean is needed as follows - org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.jdbc.JdbcTemplateConfiguration usually provides a default JdbcTemplate instance - but it doesn't if any other JdbcTemplate bean is created - we add the custom scalarDbJdbcTemplate bean and the above issue happens
        Parameters:
        dataSource - a data source
        Returns:
        a default bean

      • scalarDbJdbcTemplate

        @Bean
public ScalarDbJdbcTemplate scalarDbJdbcTemplate(javax.sql.DataSource dataSource)
        Return a customized ScalarDbJdbcTemplate instance. This is for "Spring Data JDBC for ScalarDB".
        Parameters:
        dataSource - a data source
        Returns:
        a customized bean

      • namedParameterJdbcTemplate

        @Bean
 @Primary
public org.springframework.jdbc.core.namedparam.NamedParameterJdbcTemplate namedParameterJdbcTemplate(javax.sql.DataSource dataSource)
        Return a NamedParameterJdbcTemplate instance as a default bean. This is for vanilla Spring Data JDBC usage. This default bean is needed as follows - org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.jdbc.NamedParameterJdbcTemplateConfiguration usually provides a default NamedParameterJdbcTemplate instance - but it doesn't if any other NamedParameterJdbcTemplate bean is created - we add the custom scalarDbNamedParameterJdbcTemplate bean and the above issue happens
        Parameters:
        dataSource - a data source
        Returns:
        a default bean

      • scalarDbNamedParameterJdbcTemplate

        @Bean
public org.springframework.jdbc.core.namedparam.NamedParameterJdbcTemplate scalarDbNamedParameterJdbcTemplate(javax.sql.DataSource dataSource)
        Return a customized ScalarDbJdbcTemplate instance. This is for "Spring Data JDBC for ScalarDB". EnableScalarDbRepositories.jdbcOperationsRef() uses this by default.
        Parameters:
        dataSource - a data source
        Returns:
        a customized bean
